description: A traditional Isan-style dish made with raw or lightly cooked beef mixed with lime juice, fish sauce, chili, and fresh herbs. Known for its bold and tangy flavor, it’s often enjoyed with sticky rice.
A Chinese-influenced Thai soup featuring rolled rice noodles, pork belly, garlic, soy sauce, and a peppery broth. Often served with a variety of pork cuts and a hard-boiled egg.

thai_script: ก๋วยเตี๋ยว
description: A versatile noodle soup commonly made with rice noodles, pork or chicken, bean sprouts, garlic, and fish sauce. Found at nearly every street food stall across Thailand.

thai_script: ก๋วยเตี๋ยวแขก
description: A noodle dish influenced by Thai-Muslim cuisine, featuring beef with curry powder, coconut milk, and aromatic spices. Rich, savory, and slightly sweet.

thai_script: ก๋วยเตี๋ยวคั่วไก่
description: Flat rice noodles stir-fried with chicken, garlic, and soy sauce for a smoky flavor. Often served with a runny fried egg on top.

thai_script: ก๋วยเตี๋ยวปากหม้อ
description: A noodle soup featuring steamed rice flour dumplings filled with pork, garlic, and herbs. Served in a light broth, it is a delicate and comforting dish.

thai_script: ก๋วยเตี๋ยวมอญ
description: A traditional noodle soup influenced by the Mon people, made with rice noodles, pork, herbs, and fish sauce. Known for its simple yet fragrant flavors.

thai_script: ก๋วยเตี๋ยวเรือ
description: A famous Thai street food dish of rice noodles in a rich broth flavored with pork or beef, herbs, and a touch of pig’s or cow’s blood for depth. Typically served in small bowls with bean sprouts.

thai_script: กุ้งแช่น้ำปลา
description: A spicy and tangy dish of raw shrimp marinated in fish sauce, garlic, lime, and chili. It is a popular Thai appetizer with bold flavors.

thai_script: เกยย้งก๊กเซียงบี๊
description: A lesser-known Central Thai dish made with pork, soy sauce, and mixed herbs. It is savory and aromatic, often enjoyed with rice.
A clear beef broth soup often served without noodles, containing vegetables, garlic, fish sauce, and cuts of pork or beef. It is light yet savory, commonly enjoyed with rice.
A comforting noodle soup made with short, round rice noodles served in a clear broth with pork, garlic, and fish sauce. Popular for its mild and soothing flavor.
A Southern Thai specialty of chicken marinated with coconut milk, turmeric, and aromatic spices, then grilled over charcoal. Known for its smoky, spicy, and rich flavor.
A regional chicken dish prepared with soy sauce, garlic, and local spices. It has a savory, slightly sweet taste and is typically eaten with rice.
A Northern Thai dish where chicken is marinated with herbs, garlic, and soy sauce, then cooked slowly in its own juices. The result is tender, aromatic, and full of flavor.
A popular Isan-style dish of chicken marinated with garlic, soy sauce, and spices, then grilled until smoky and crisp. Traditionally served with sticky rice and spicy dipping sauce.
A traditional Central Thai dish where chicken is marinated with soy sauce, garlic, and herbs, then roasted over burning straw. This unique method gives the meat a smoky aroma and tender texture.
Thin rice noodles made from fermented rice, usually served with various curries or coconut milk-based sauces. A staple dish across Thailand, often eaten with fresh vegetables and herbs.

thai_script: ขนมจีนแกงไก่คั่ว
description: Fermented rice noodles topped with a rich chicken curry made with coconut milk and aromatic spices. This dish is creamy, savory, and widely enjoyed in many regions of Thailand.

thai_script: ข้าวกั๊นจิ๊น
description: A Northern Thai specialty of rice mixed with pork blood, seasoned with garlic and fish sauce, and steamed inside banana leaves. It is typically served with fresh vegetables and chili.
A beloved Thai street food dish featuring tender stewed pork leg served over rice with soy sauce, garlic, and star anise seasoning. Commonly accompanied by pickled mustard greens and a boiled egg.

thai_script: ข้าวคลุกกะปิ
description: A fragrant Thai rice dish stir-fried with shrimp paste and served with accompaniments like sweet pork, egg, shallots, and fresh chili. It is savory, aromatic, and slightly spicy.
A Northeastern Thai snack made from sticky rice molded into patties, brushed with egg or soy sauce, and grilled until crispy. It is smoky, crunchy, and often eaten as street food.
A traditional Central Thai summer dish of rice soaked in cool jasmine-scented water, served with side dishes like shrimp paste balls, stuffed shallots, and sweet pork. It is refreshing and aromatic.
A creamy coconut curry noodle soup topped with chicken or beef, crispy fried noodles, pickled mustard greens, and shallots. It is a famous Northern Thai dish with Burmese influences.

thai_script: ข้าวดอกราย
description: A traditional northern Thai dish made from glutinous rice mixed with shredded coconut and sugar. It is mildly sweet, fragrant, and often served as a local snack or dessert.
A comforting Thai rice porridge often served with pork, garlic, fish sauce, and ginger. It is commonly eaten as a breakfast or late-night meal across Thailand.
A lesser-known traditional dish, believed to be a regional specialty. Specific preparation details are limited, but it is considered a type of local rice-based dish.
A classic Thai fried rice dish stir-fried with garlic, soy sauce, egg, and a choice of meat or seafood. Often served with cucumber slices and lime on the side.

thai_script: ข้าวผัดสับปะรด
description: A colorful fried rice dish cooked with pineapple chunks, shrimp or chicken, raisins, and cashew nuts. It has a sweet and savory flavor and is often served in a hollowed pineapple.

thai_script: ข้าวผัดอเมริกัน
description: A Central Thai adaptation of fried rice flavored with ketchup, served with side items like fried egg, sausage, ham, or fried chicken. It was influenced by Western tastes during the Vietnam War era.

thai_script: ข้าวมันแกงไก่
description: A savory dish of rice served with fragrant chicken curry simmered in coconut milk, garlic, and spices. It is hearty and flavorful, often enjoyed as a filling meal.

thai_script: ข้าวมันไก่
description: A popular Thai street food adapted from Hainanese cuisine, featuring tender boiled chicken served over garlic-infused rice with a savory soy-based dipping sauce and fresh cucumber.

thai_script: ข้าวมันส้มตำ
description: A fusion dish that pairs sticky rice with the spicy and tangy flavors of som tam (green papaya salad). It balances heat, sourness, and sweetness, making it a lively street food favorite.

A traditional Thai dessert made from young glutinous rice grains that are pounded into soft flakes, often mixed with ripe banana and coconut milk. It is fragrant, slightly chewy, and enjoyed as a seasonal treat across Thailand.
A Southern Thai specialty combining rice with fresh vegetables, herbs, toasted coconut, and a spicy-sour dressing. It is colorful, refreshing, and deeply aromatic.

thai_script: ข้าวราดหน้าไก่
description: A Central Thai dish of rice topped with stir-fried chicken in a savory gravy made with soy sauce, garlic, and thickened broth. It is hearty and commonly served as quick street food.

thai_script: ข้าวแรมฟืน
description: A Northern Thai specialty made from chickpea or rice flour jelly cut into cubes and served with a savory sauce, chili, and herbs. It has a soft texture and a unique, refreshing taste.

thai_script: ข้าวเสียโป
description: A traditional dish believed to have Chinese-Thai origins, consisting of rice served with mixed meats, broth, and aromatic seasonings. It is known as a comforting, filling one-dish meal.

thai_script: ข้าวหน้าเป็ด
description: A well-loved Thai-Chinese dish of sliced roasted duck served over rice with soy sauce, garlic, and fragrant duck gravy. Often accompanied by pickled ginger and a sweet chili sauce.
The Thai Muslim version of biryani, made with fragrant yellow rice cooked with turmeric and spices, served with chicken or beef. It is especially popular in Southern Thailand.
A Northern Thai dish where eggs are beaten with garlic and herbs, then grilled inside a banana leaf cup. The result is a smoky and fragrant egg dish often enjoyed with sticky rice.
A Thai version of rice porridge of Chinese origin, usually cooked with minced pork, garlic, and fish sauce. It is a popular breakfast dish often served with a poached egg and fresh ginger.
A Northeastern Thai dish of raw or lightly seared beef mixed with fresh herbs, lime juice, chili, and garlic. It is bold, tangy, and often eaten with sticky rice.
An Isan dish usually prepared as a spicy-sour soup with herbs, lime, chili, and seasonal vegetables. Variations include beef tendon soup or mushroom soup with a refreshing, tangy flavor.
A variation of the famous papaya salad, made with cucumbers instead of papaya, mixed with chili, garlic, lime, and fish sauce. It is refreshing, crunchy, and spicy.
A Northeastern Thai salad made with grilled beef or pork, sliced thin and tossed with lime juice, chili, fish sauce, and roasted rice powder. It is bold, smoky, and usually enjoyed with sticky rice.
A spicy stir-fried noodle dish made with wide rice noodles, chili, garlic, holy basil, and mixed vegetables. Known for its heat and bold flavors, it is often eaten as a late-night meal.
Wide rice noodles stir-fried with soy sauce, Chinese broccoli, egg, and either chicken, pork, or beef. A staple Thai street food with a smoky, savory taste.
Thailand’s most famous noodle dish, stir-fried with rice noodles, egg, bean sprouts, tofu, and shrimp or chicken. Flavored with fish sauce, tamarind, and lime, and topped with crushed peanuts.

thai_script: พระรามลงสรง
description: A Thai dish of blanched spinach or morning glory topped with sliced pork or chicken and smothered in a rich peanut sauce. The name means 'Rama taking a bath'.
A salad of mixed boiled vegetables served with a coconut cream and peanut dressing, often considered a royal-inspired dish. It is mild, creamy, and nutritious.

thai_script: ยำปลาดุกฟู
description: A well-known Thai salad made from deep-fried, shredded catfish served with a tangy green mango salad. Crispy, sour, spicy, and refreshing, it is a popular appetizer or shared dish.
A Thai salad made with three crispy ingredients, often pork rind, cashews, and fried shrimp, tossed with lime juice, chili, and fish sauce. It has a crunchy texture and a bold, tangy flavor.
A traditional Thai mixed salad that combines vegetables, pork, and shrimp with a sweet and tangy fish sauce-based dressing. It is considered one of Thailand’s classic royal-inspired dishes.
A noodle soup with a distinctive pink broth made from fermented bean curd, served with fish balls, fried tofu, morning glory, and wide rice noodles. It is savory, slightly sweet, and tangy.
A traditional Southern Thai Muslim curry dish, rich with coconut milk, spices, and herbs. Its exact preparation varies but it is deeply flavorful and aromatic.
A popular street food made with wide rice noodles topped with a thick savory gravy, Chinese broccoli, and meat such as pork, chicken, or seafood. It is rich, smooth, and comforting.
A traditional northern Thai noodle dish served with a light curry-style broth, herbs, and fresh vegetables. It has a mild, savory flavor and is enjoyed as a local specialty.
Minced meat salad+fish sauce+garlic
Thailand’s iconic salad made with shredded green papaya, garlic, chili, lime, fish sauce, and peanuts. It is spicy, sour, salty, and slightly sweet, often eaten with sticky rice and grilled meats.
A little-documented regional dish with unclear origins. It is believed to be a rustic preparation using local ingredients and traditional seasoning styles.

thai_script: เสือร้องไห้
description: A famous Northeastern Thai grilled beef dish, marinated and charred over open flames. Served with a spicy jaew dipping sauce made of chili, lime, and roasted rice powder.

thai_script: ไส้กรอกอีสาน
description: A traditional Northeastern Thai sausage made from pork, garlic, sticky rice, and salt, left to ferment before grilling. It has a tangy flavor and is commonly eaten with fresh chilies and cabbage.
A signature sausage of Northern Thailand made with minced pork, garlic, chili, lemongrass, and herbs. It is aromatic, spicy, and grilled until juicy and smoky.
A traditional fermented sausage found in Northeastern Thailand, made from beef or pork mixed with garlic and spices, then cured. It has a strong, tangy flavor and is often eaten grilled.

A traditional Central Thai dish of crispy fried rice noodles coated in a sweet and tangy sauce made with tamarind, sugar, and fish sauce. It is crunchy, fragrant, and often garnished with herbs and citrus peel.
A Central Thai noodle dish made with thin rice noodles topped with a rich coconut milk-based sauce, ground peanuts, and a hint of fish sauce. It is creamy, savory, and slightly sweet.
A refreshing Thai dish of sliced pork served with a spicy lime, garlic, and chili dressing. It is tangy and bold, often eaten with fresh vegetables and sticky rice.
A popular Thai street food consisting of a crispy omelette with oysters, fish sauce, garlic, and bean sprouts. It is savory, crunchy on the outside, and chewy inside.
A traditional northern Thai dish of small freshwater crabs pounded with herbs and spices, then wrapped in banana leaves and grilled. It has a smoky, savory flavor and is often eaten with sticky rice.
A lesser-known Thai dish with limited information available, believed to have regional roots. Its preparation and flavors vary depending on local traditions.

thai_script: แกงกระด้าง
description: A traditional Northern Thai dish where pork is simmered with herbs and seasonings, then cooled to form a natural jelly-like consistency. It is usually enjoyed during the cool season.
A mild curry made with curry powder, coconut milk, and meat such as chicken or beef. It has Indian influences and features a creamy, lightly spiced flavor.
A Northern Thai curry made with young jackfruit, pork, and aromatic herbs. It is hearty, earthy, and slightly tangy, often served with sticky rice.

thai_script: แกงขี้เหล็ก
description: A bitter-savory curry made with Senna siamea leaves, coconut milk, and pork or fish. The bitterness of the leaves is balanced by rich coconut milk and spices.

thai_script: แกงเขียวหวาน
description: One of Thailand’s most famous curries, made with green curry paste, coconut milk, and meat such as chicken or beef. It is aromatic, spicy, and slightly sweet from the coconut milk.
A rich and spicy curry made with red curry paste, coconut milk, and meat or seafood. It is popular in Southern Thailand and often has a stronger chili flavor.
A traditional Northern Thai curry made with a variety of herbs, vegetables, and meat. It is light, fragrant, and deeply herbal in flavor, often served with sticky rice.

thai_script: แกงจีนจ๊วน
description: A traditional curry dish combining pork, herbs, and fermented fish for a rich and pungent flavor. It reflects regional Thai culinary traditions with bold, savory notes.
A mild and clear Thai soup made with vegetables, tofu, glass noodles, and sometimes pork or chicken. It is light, soothing, and often served as a side dish in family meals.
A sour curry flavored with tamarind paste, herbs, and fish. It has a tangy and refreshing taste, balancing sourness with the savory depth of the broth.
A traditional northern Thai curry made with pork, herbs, and local vegetables. It has a rich, earthy flavor and is usually enjoyed with steamed rice.
A lesser-known Thai curry with limited available details, believed to be prepared with local spices and herbs. Its flavor is strong and deeply regional.

english_name: Pork Belly Curry with Morning Glory
description: A classic Central Thai curry made with pork belly, red curry paste, coconut milk, and morning glory stems. It is rich, mildly spicy, and slightly tangy from tamarind.
A traditional Thai curry named after 'Nine Gems,' said to include a variety of nine ingredients such as vegetables, herbs, and meat. It symbolizes abundance and harmony in Thai cuisine.

thai_script: แกงนอกหม้อ
description: A traditional northern Thai curry made with mixed local vegetables and herbs, simmered without coconut milk. It is light, aromatic, and usually eaten with steamed rice.
A traditional northern Thai curry made with pork, young jackfruit, and local herbs. It has a hearty, earthy flavor and is typically eaten with sticky rice.
A Central Thai curry made with pork blood, herbs, and vegetables. It has a distinctive earthy flavor and is considered a traditional rustic dish.
A curry made with taro stems, meat, and curry paste. The taro stems give it a unique texture while the curry paste provides a savory and spicy flavor.

thai_script: แกงบุ่มไบ่
description: A coconut milk curry featuring chicken cooked with curry paste and herbs. It has a rich and creamy flavor typical of Southern and Central Thai curries.
A traditional southern Thai Muslim curry made with beef or goat simmered in coconut milk, turmeric, and spices. It is rich, fragrant, and often enjoyed with rice or roti.
A traditional Thai curry without coconut milk, made with a variety of wild herbs, vegetables, and meat. It is intensely spicy, aromatic, and watery in texture, reflecting its forest origins.
A Northeastern Thai curry made with fermented fish, curry paste, and seasonal vegetables. It is rustic, spicy, and full of earthy, tangy flavors typical of Isan cuisine.
A classic Thai curry made with red curry paste, coconut milk, and meat such as chicken, pork, or beef. It is aromatic, spicy, and one of the most popular curries in Thailand.

thai_script: แกงมัสมั่น
description: A Southern Thai curry with Persian and Indian influences, made with massaman curry paste, coconut milk, potatoes, peanuts, and slow-cooked meat such as beef or chicken. It is rich, mildly spicy, and slightly sweet.
A traditional Thai soup-like curry, sometimes compared to a mixed vegetable or clear curry. It is served hot with a combination of herbs, vegetables, and meat in a light broth.
A Central Thai curry with Malay influences, made with yellow curry paste, coconut milk, and beef or chicken. It has a deep golden color, aromatic spices, and a slightly sweet flavor.
A traditional Central Thai curry made with leftover grilled pork, shrimp paste, herbs, and tamarind. It is known for its sour, salty, and slightly smoky flavor.
A light and spicy Thai soup made with shrimp, herbs, and mixed vegetables such as pumpkin, baby corn, and squash blossoms. It is aromatic and nutritious, often eaten with rice.
A lesser-known Thai curry dish with limited records, believed to feature a mix of vegetables and meat in a curry paste broth. The name suggests a 'mixed' or 'varied' curry.
A popular Thai sour curry made with tamarind-based curry paste, fish, and vegetables such as green papaya or morning glory. It has a tangy, spicy, and refreshing flavor.
A regional Thai curry prepared with wild herbs, vegetables, and meat. It is rustic and herbal in flavor, reflecting local cooking traditions.
A traditional northern Thai curry made with minced bird meat, chili, and local herbs. It is spicy, aromatic, and usually eaten with sticky rice.
A traditional southern Thai curry influenced by Sri Lankan flavors, made with beef, coconut milk, and spices. It is rich, spicy, and usually eaten with rice or roti.
A traditional northern Thai curry made with young jackfruit, chili paste, and herbs. It has a mild, earthy flavor and is often eaten with sticky rice.

thai_script: แกงเหงาหงอด
description: A Northern Thai curry with scarce documentation, thought to be made with pork or beef stewed in herbs and spices unique to the region.
A spicy and sour Southern Thai curry made with yellow curry paste, turmeric, tamarind, and fish with vegetables such as bamboo shoots or green papaya.
A Burmese-influenced Northern Thai curry made with pork belly, ginger, garlic, and Hang Lay curry paste. It is rich, slightly sour, and aromatic.
A Northern Thai curry-stir-fry made from mixed leftover curries stir-fried with glass noodles, pickled bamboo shoots, kaffir lime leaves, and herbs. It is spicy, tangy, and aromatic.

thai_script: ไก่ห่อใบเตย
description: A Thai dish of marinated chicken wrapped in pandan leaves and deep-fried. The pandan adds a fragrant aroma while keeping the chicken juicy.

thai_script: ขาไก่ซุปเปอร์
description: A spicy and tangy Thai soup made with chicken feet simmered in chili, lime juice, and herbs until tender. Known for its bold flavors.
A fluffy Thai omelet made with eggs, fish sauce, and oil, fried until golden and crispy on the edges. Often served over rice.
A Thai-style fried egg with crispy edges and a runny yolk, often served as a topping for stir-fried dishes and curries.
A light Thai egg soup made with beaten eggs simmered in clear broth with vegetables and sometimes minced pork. Simple, mild, and comforting.
A Thai stuffed omelet filled with minced pork, onions, tomatoes, peas, and carrots, seasoned with soy sauce and garlic. It is savory and hearty.
A rustic Thai dish meaning 'exploded eggs,' made by deep-frying whole eggs until the skin blisters, then serving with spicy sauce or curry paste.
image_url: https://images.aws.nestle.recipes/original/c6ef16a68ec869c4297382f7084ed77c_ข้าวไข่ระเบิด.jpg

description: A Thai dish of boiled eggs deep-fried until golden, then topped with tamarind sauce, fried shallots, and dried chilies. It is sweet, sour, and savory.
A dry Southern Thai curry made with ground pork or beef stir-fried with spicy curry paste, kaffir lime leaves, and herbs. Intensely hot and aromatic.
A traditional Central Thai dish of fish or seafood mixed with curry paste, wrapped in banana leaves, and grilled until smoky and fragrant.
A Northern Thai soup made with pickled mustard greens simmered with pork ribs, tomatoes, and herbs. It is savory, tangy, and comforting.
A rare Northern Thai dish, believed to be a variation of mustard green soup cooked with less broth, resulting in a more concentrated flavor.
A Thai-Chinese vegetable stew made from assorted vegetables simmered with soy sauce, garlic, and pork or chicken. It is mild, savory, and nourishing.
A rich Thai curry dish made with red curry paste, coconut milk, and fish or seafood. It is thick, aromatic, and slightly sweet with a spicy kick.

thai_script: ซุปเครื่องใน
description: A Thai-style offal soup made with pork or beef organs simmered with lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, and chili, resulting in a hearty and spicy broth.

thai_script: ซุปสิงคโปร์
description: A Thai-Muslim beef soup inspired by Malay and Singaporean cuisine, slow-cooked with spices such as star anise, cinnamon, and coriander.

english_name: A traditional northern Thai noodle dish served with a light broth, fresh herbs, and local vegetables. It has a simple, savory flavor and is often eaten as a rustic village-style meal.

description: A mild Thai soup made with coconut milk, meat, mushrooms, and fresh herbs. It is creamy, lightly savory, and less spicy than other soups.
image_url: https://images.aws.nestle.recipes/original/a06747fed6c119c2802bfbf1fa594317_ใบเหลียงต้มกะทิ.png

description: A famous Thai soup of chicken simmered in coconut milk with galangal, lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, and chili. It is creamy, aromatic, and slightly sour.

thai_script: ต้มเครื่องในหมู
description: A traditional Thai soup made with pork offal simmered in a clear broth with lemongrass, galangal, kaffir lime leaves, and chili. It is savory and aromatic.
A traditional Thai soup made with smoked or dried fish, lemongrass, galangal, and roasted chilies. It has a smoky, spicy, and tangy flavor.
A sour and spicy Thai soup flavored with lime, garlic, and chili, usually made with beef or pork. It is tangy, hot, and aromatic.
A Northeastern Thai (Isan) spicy and sour soup made with pork ribs or beef, lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, and fresh chilies. It is bold and fiery.
A strong, spicy, anf fragrant curry similar to Tom Yum, but heavy emphasis on eels. Heavy use of herbs like lemongrass and kaffir lime to eliminate the fishy flavor and smell of the eel.
Thailand’s world-famous hot and sour soup, made with shrimp or other proteins, lemongrass, galangal, kaffir lime leaves, and chilies. It is spicy, tangy, and fragrant.
A traditional Thai sour soup made with fish, tamarind juice, shallots, and herbs. It is tangy, light, and mildly sweet.
Tupa Sutong is a southern Thai Muslim dish of squid stuffed with sticky rice and simmered in sweet coconut milk. It has a half-sweet, half-savory flavor and is enjoyed as a dessert or snack.
A traditional Southern Thai curry made with fermented fish entrails, curry paste, bamboo shoots, eggplant, and other vegetables. It is intensely salty, spicy, and rich in flavor.
A popular Thai dish made from fish paste mixed with red curry paste, long beans, and kaffir lime leaves, then deep-fried until golden. Served with cucumber relish.
A Northern Thai noodle soup made with rice noodles, pork, tomatoes, blood tofu, and fermented soybean paste, flavored with dried red cotton flowers.

thai_script: เนื้อนางเพา
description: Nang Pao is a Thai dish of grilled or fried beef topped with a thick curry-like sauce and salted egg yolk. It reflects Persian influences and is often served as an appetizer.
image_url: https://cheewajit.com/app/uploads/2017/03/เนื้อนางเพา-เว็บ-1.jpg

description: Bo Toa is a southern Thai dish made with fish mixed with coconut milk and herbs. It has a fragrant, creamy flavor that balances richness with the natural taste of fish.

Pla Kok is a Chonburi dish of salted sea carp simmered with pickled mustard greens, lemongrass, garlic, chilies, and duck sauce until tender. It is usually enjoyed with rice porridge or steamed rice..
A dish of crab shells stuffed with a mixture of crab meat, pork, garlic, and spices, then deep-fried until golden. Often served with plum sauce.
One of Thailand’s most famous stir-fry dishes, made with holy basil, garlic, chili, and meat such as pork, chicken, or seafood. Served with rice and often topped with a fried egg.
A Thai stir-fried dish with sliced ginger, garlic, meat such as chicken or pork, and vegetables. It is aromatic, slightly spicy, and savory.
A spicy Thai stir-fry made with chili paste, garlic, green peppercorns, kaffir lime leaves, and meat or seafood. It is intensely spicy and aromatic.

thai_script: ผัดเปรี้ยวหวาน
description: A Thai stir-fried dish with a sweet and sour sauce, meat such as pork or chicken, pineapple, tomato, cucumber, and onion.

thai_script: ผัดผงกะหรี่
description: A Thai stir-fried curry dish with curry powder, egg, onion, celery, and meat or seafood, most famously crab. It is rich, savory, and mildly spicy.

thai_script: ผัดผักบุ้ง
description: A popular Thai vegetable dish of water spinach stir-fried with garlic, chili, and soy sauce. It is quick, savory, and slightly spicy.

thai_script: ผัดพริกขิง
description: A dry Thai curry stir-fry made with red curry paste, long beans, kaffir lime leaves, and meat such as pork or chicken. It is spicy, aromatic, and flavorful.

thai_script: ผัดสามเหม็น
description: A stir-fried Thai dish known as 'three stinky stir-fry,' made with cha-om leaves, sataw beans, and stink beans. It is pungent, savory, and full of herbal flavors.
A spicy Thai salad made with lightly cooked or raw meat or seafood mixed with herbs, lime juice, chili, and fish sauce. It is tangy, spicy, and aromatic.
A rich and creamy Thai curry made with Panang curry paste, coconut milk, kaffir lime leaves, and meat, usually beef or chicken. It is mildly spicy and slightly sweet.
A Chinese-influenced Thai stew made with pork belly, tofu, and hard-boiled eggs simmered in soy sauce with five-spice powder, garlic, and cinnamon.

thai_script: ยำไก่อย่างเต่า
description: Yam Kai Yang Tao is a unique Thai salad made with grilled chicken tossed in chili, lime, fish sauce, and herbs. It combines smoky, spicy, and tangy flavors, and is often enjoyed as a local specialty dish.
A Thai salad made with crispy fried eggs topped with onions, chili, lime juice, and fish sauce. It is spicy, sour, and savory.
Yam Sanat is a traditional southern Thai salad made with fresh herbs, chili, lime, and fish sauce. It has a spicy, tangy flavor and is enjoyed as a local specialty.
Lae Wa Kadam is a southern Thai Muslim curry made with fish, coconut milk, and local herbs. It is rich, aromatic, and often enjoyed with steamed rice.
A spicy Thai soup made with pork spine simmered with lemongrass, lime, chili, and herbs, producing a tangy and fiery broth.
A Northeastern Thai dish resembling larb, made with minced meat, chili, lime, and roasted rice powder. It is spicy, sour, and aromatic.
A Northern and Northeastern Thai dish similar to 'aeb,' made of minced fish, chicken, or mushrooms mixed with curry paste, wrapped in banana leaves, and steamed.
A Central Thai dish of minced pork or shrimp simmered in coconut milk with fermented soybeans or shrimp paste, eaten with fresh vegetables.
A traditional dish from Chanthaburi made with pork stewed in Garcinia cowa leaves, giving it a distinctive sour and savory flavor.
A sweet Thai pork dish where pork is simmered with palm sugar, soy sauce, and garlic until tender and caramelized.
A Southern Thai stewed pork belly dish influenced by Hokkien cuisine, slow-cooked with soy sauce, garlic, and spices until tender.
A traditional Northeastern Thai (Isan) herbal stew made with meat, dill, lemongrass, and assorted vegetables. It is fragrant, savory, and slightly bitter.
A traditional Thai-Chinese steamed dish made with crab or pork mixed with egg and soy sauce. It is savory, silky, and often enjoyed with rice.
A Northern Thai dish of minced pork, fish, or mushrooms mixed with curry paste, wrapped in banana leaves, and grilled until smoky and aromatic.
A traditional Thai royal dessert shaped like a small cone. Made from flour, coconut milk, and sugar, it is delicate, mildly sweet, and often served at ceremonial occasions
A crispy Thai snack made from rice flour seasoned with fish sauce and herbs, fried until golden and crunchy with a savory taste.
image_url: https://dessertsmate.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/217-ขนมกรอบเค็ม-แป้งกรอบเคี้ยวเพลิน.jpg

description: A royal Thai appetizer made from crispy golden pastry cups filled with minced meat, corn, peas, and vegetables, seasoned with garlic and pepper.
A traditional Thai snack of battered and deep-fried pumpkin or vegetables, served crispy with sweet chili sauce.

thai_script: ก๋วยเตี๋ยวหลอด
description: Steamed rice noodle rolls filled with mushrooms, tofu, or pork, drizzled with soy sauce and garnished with fried garlic and coriander.

thai_script: กะหรี่ปั๊บ
description: A flaky pastry filled with curried potatoes, onions, and sometimes chicken. Crispy outside and savory inside, popular as a Thai street snack.

thai_script: การเวกสอดสี
description: A traditional Thai royal dish of egg roulade stuffed with Chinese sausage, pork, and vegetables. It is savory, colorful, and often served as part of ceremonial or royal cuisine.
A Northern Thai delicacy of live baby shrimp mixed with lime juice, chili, shallots, and herbs, causing the shrimp to 'dance.' It is spicy, sour, and fresh.
A famous Thai snack brand known for crunchy peanuts coated in a coconut cream shell, seasoned in sweet, salty, or spicy flavors.

thai_script: ไก่สามอย่าง
description: A traditional Thai snack platter of assorted toppings such as peanuts, dried shrimp, lime, shallots, and chilies. Served with sweet palm sugar sauce, it is eaten wrapped in leaves or with rice.

thai_script: ขนมกุยช่าย
description: A Thai-Chinese snack made of rice flour dough filled with chopped chives, steamed, and served with soy and chili sauce.
A traditional Chinese-Thai dessert made from glutinous rice flour, sugar, and water, steamed in small cups. It is chewy, sticky, and commonly prepared during Chinese New Year.
Thai-style dim sum dumplings filled with minced pork, shrimp, and garlic, wrapped in wonton skins and steamed. Often served with soy or chili sauce.

thai_script: ขนมโตเกียว
description: A popular Thai street dessert of thin pancakes filled with sweet custard, cream, or savory fillings like sausage and quail eggs.

thai_script: ขนมปังขาไก่
description: Crispy breadstick-like cookies made from flour, sugar, and butter. Light and crunchy, they are a common Thai bakery snack.

thai_script: ขนมปังหน้าหมู
description: A Thai appetizer of bread squares topped with minced pork mixed with garlic and pepper, then deep-fried until crispy. Served with cucumber relish.
A Thai-Chinese savory snack made from shredded radish and rice flour, steamed into cakes and later pan-fried with soy sauce and bean sprouts.

thai_script: ขนมพวงประทัด
description: A Thai snack created in the reign of King Rama V. It is made from roti dough stuffed with stir-fried carrots, cabbage, and mushrooms, then fried until crisp and eaten with a sweet and spicy dipping sauce.

thai_script: ข้าวเกรียบกุ้ง
description: A popular Thai snack made from ground shrimp mixed with tapioca flour and seasonings, then sun-dried and deep-fried until puffy and crispy.

thai_script: ข้าวเกรียบปากหม้อ
description: A traditional Thai snack of thin steamed rice flour sheets filled with minced pork, garlic, and herbs, served with fried garlic and sweet chili sauce.

thai_script: ข้าวเกรียบยาหน้า
description: Rice crackers topped with a savory mixture of minced meat, peanuts, and herbs, offering a crunchy texture with rich flavors.

thai_script: ข้าวต้มใบกะพ้อ
description: A traditional Thai dessert of sticky rice mixed with banana and coconut milk, wrapped in palm leaves and steamed until fragrant.

thai_script: ข้าวต้มมัด
description: A dessert made from sticky rice, banana, and coconut milk, wrapped in banana leaves and tied into small bundles before steaming. Often eaten during festivals.

thai_script: ข้าวตังหน้าตั้ง
description: A traditional Thai appetizer of crispy rice crackers topped with a savory dip made from minced pork, shrimp, coconut milk, and peanuts.
A Northern Thai dish of steamed rice sheets wrapped around vegetables and sometimes minced pork, served with a dipping sauce.

thai_script: ข้าวห่อทอด
description: A fried Thai snack made of rice wrapped with meat or vegetable filling, then deep-fried until crispy and golden.

thai_script: ข้าวเหนียวปิ้ง
description: Grilled sticky rice parcels filled with sweetened banana or taro, wrapped in banana leaves and roasted until fragrant.
An old-style Thai egg dish where seasoned eggs are steamed or baked with herbs and spices, creating a firm and savory custard-like texture.

thai_script: ครองแครงกรอบ
description: A traditional Thai crispy snack made from rice flour dough shaped into small shells, deep-fried, and coated with sugar syrup and sesame seeds.

thai_script: ค้างคาวเผือก
description: A savory Thai appetizer made from mashed taro mixed with flour and seasonings, shaped like small bats, and deep-fried until golden and crispy.
Crispy pork rinds made from fried pork skin, seasoned with salt and spices. A Northern Thai specialty often eaten with chili dip (nam prik noom).
image_url: https://www.sgethai.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/12/221207-Content-วิธีทำ-แคบหมู03.webp

description: A royal Thai appetizer of flower-shaped dumplings filled with minced chicken or pork and herbs, tinted purple with butterfly pea flower extract.
A Thai-Chinese style fried spring roll made with wheat flour wrappers stuffed with minced pork, glass noodles, and vegetables.
Steamed buns of Chinese origin filled with sweet or savory fillings such as barbecued pork, red bean paste, or custard. Soft and fluffy.
image_url: https://ufm.co.th/wp-content/uploads/2022/10/แป้งสาลีในการทำซาลาเปา-แป้งข้าวสาลี-แป้งสาลียูเอฟเอ็ม-สำหรับทำซาลาเปา-ตราบัวแดง-UFM-4-1024x683.jpg

thai_script: ซุปอาสาเรน
description: A Thai-style vegetable and herb soup with egg, providing a light, savory, and nutritious flavor profile.
A traditional Thai appetizer whose name means 'shrimp flower,' typically made by shaping shrimp paste into flower-like forms and deep-frying until golden.
A traditional Thai dish made by deep-frying beaten eggs into small flower-like shapes. Light and crispy, it is often served as a savory snack or side dish.
A crispy fried appetizer made from wonton wrappers filled with minced pork, shrimp, and vegetables, tied like small golden pouches. Served with sweet chili sauce.
A traditional northern Thai rice cracker made from steamed sticky rice that is sun-dried and deep-fried until crisp. It is light, crunchy, and often eaten as a snack.
An old royal Thai dish consisting of minced fish mixed with roasted rice, peanuts, and coconut, served with fresh fruits and herbs. It is savory, sweet, and aromatic.

thai_script: ปลาแห้งแตงโม
description: A refreshing Thai summer snack of sweet watermelon served with shredded dried fish and sugar. It combines sweet, salty, and savory flavors.
A Southern Thai deep-fried dumpling filled with minced fish, garlic, and spices. Crispy on the outside and savory inside, it is a popular snack in the South.
image_url: https://www.thaipower.co/wp-content/uploads/2021/11/Product-เพลินตาปั้นสิบ-6-1.jpg

description: Thai-style deep-fried dough sticks made from flour and yeast. Crispy on the outside and soft inside, they are often eaten with coffee or condensed milk at breakfast.

thai_script: เปาะเปี๊ยะ
description: Deep-fried rolls filled with minced pork, glass noodles, and vegetables. A Thai adaptation of Chinese spring rolls, crispy and savory.
A Southern Thai stuffed roti filled with egg, onion, and vegetables, pan-fried until golden. It has Indian-Malay influences and is both savory and filling.
A Thai-Chinese steamed meatball dish made from minced pork mixed with soy sauce, garlic, and pepper. Soft and savory, it is often eaten with rice as a homestyle comfort food.
A traditional royal Thai appetizer where minced pork or chicken stir-fried with garlic and peanuts is served on pineapple or tangerine slices. It is sweet, salty, and tangy.
A traditional Thai snack of wild betel leaves wrapped around roasted coconut, peanuts, lime, chili, dried shrimp, and palm sugar syrup. It is sweet, salty, spicy, and aromatic.
A royal Thai appetizer made of a golden egg net filled with minced pork, shrimp, and herbs. It is delicate, savory, and historically served at banquets.
A flaky flatbread of Indian origin, made from flour and oil, pan-fried until golden. In Thailand, it is often served with sweetened condensed milk or curry.
A Southern Thai-Chinese dish of deep-fried pork offal and tofu seasoned with five-spice powder. It is savory, aromatic, and commonly served with dipping sauce.

thai_script: วิหคหลงรัง
description: A rare royal Thai appetizer whose name means 'bird lost in the nest.' It features minced meat and herbs wrapped in thin egg strands and fried until golden.
A refreshing Thai fruit salad combining seasonal fruits with herbs, fish sauce, and sometimes dried shrimp. It is sweet, sour, and slightly savory.
A royal Thai appetizer made of seasoned minced pork wrapped in golden egg strands. It is savory, delicate, and traditionally served at ceremonial feasts.
Grilled skewers of marinated meat served with a rich peanut sauce and cucumber relish. A dish of Malay and Indonesian origin, popular in Southern Thailand.
A traditional pork snack made from minced pork seasoned with herbs and spices, shaped into small balls, and deep-fried until golden.
Skewered pork marinated in soy sauce, garlic, and herbs, then grilled over charcoal for a smoky, savory flavor. A popular Thai street food often served with sticky rice.
A royal Thai appetizer made of seasoned minced pork and vegetables wrapped in a delicate net of thin egg strands, giving it an elegant appearance and light taste.
Dried shellfish or clams, sun-dried for preservation and later grilled or fried. Typically enjoyed as a rustic seafood snack with dipping sauces.

thai_script: หอยเสียบจิ้มมะละกอ
description: Shellfish skewers served with shredded papaya and spicy dipping sauce, combining fresh seafood with tangy, refreshing flavors.
A Phuket specialty dessert made with rice flour, coconut milk, and sugar, cooked into thin crispy pancakes that are soft in the center.
A Phuket street food stir-fry made with small oysters, taro, eggs, and crispy pork crackling. It is savory, rich, and often cooked on a large flat pan.
A deep-fried appetizer made from crab meat, minced pork, and spices wrapped in tofu skin. Crispy outside and flavorful inside, it is often served with plum sauce.
A Thai-Chinese style deep-fried roll similar to Hoi Jo, made with minced seafood, pork, and seasonings wrapped in tofu skin. Crunchy and savory.
A traditional Thai sweet made from sticky rice, peanuts, sesame, and sugar syrup. It is crunchy, sweet, and often enjoyed during the Sart Thai festival.
A popular Thai street snack of ripe bananas coated in flour batter and deep-fried until golden and crispy. It is sweet, crunchy, and often sprinkled with sesame seeds.

thai_script: กล้วยบวชชี
description: A classic Thai dessert of ripe bananas gently simmered in sweetened coconut milk. It is creamy, fragrant, and mildly sweet.
A traditional Thai shortbread cookie shaped like lamduan flowers, made from rice flour, sugar, and coconut milk. It is mildly sweet and crumbly.
A sticky Thai toffee-like candy made from glutinous rice flour, coconut milk, and palm sugar. It is chewy, sweet, and often enjoyed during festivals.
A classic Thai dessert of fruits or tubers such as pumpkin, taro, or bananas simmered in coconut milk and sugar. It is creamy, mildly sweet, and comforting.
A traditional Thai ring-shaped dessert made from rice flour and sugar, deep-fried until golden and crispy. Often compared to donuts.
A sweet snack made with rice flour, shredded coconut, and sugar, steamed or molded into small pieces. It has a chewy and lightly sweet taste.
Glutinous rice flour dumplings filled with palm sugar and coated in grated coconut. Chewy and sweet, often made for special occasions.
A Thai sweet snack made with eggs, flour, and sugar, baked into small golden cakes. It is fluffy, light, and has a mildly sweet eggy flavor.

thai_script: ขนมไข่นกกระทา
description: A popular Thai street snack made from mashed sweet potato mixed with flour and sugar, shaped into small balls, and deep-fried until crispy outside and chewy inside.

thai_script: ขนมไข่หงส์
description: A Thai-Chinese sweet snack made from glutinous rice flour dough filled with mung bean paste, deep-fried, and coated with sesame seeds. Crispy outside and soft inside, it is similar to Chinese 'Jian Dui.'
A popular Thai street snack made from rice flour, sugar, and coconut milk, cooked in a cast-iron pan. It is crispy on the outside and soft, sweet, and creamy inside.
A traditional Thai sweet snack with a humorous name, made from rice flour, sugar, and shredded coconut, shaped into elongated pieces. It is chewy and mildly sweet.
A rustic Thai sweet made from rice flour, coconut, and palm sugar, wrapped in nipa palm leaves and grilled. It has a smoky aroma and chewy texture.
An old-fashioned Thai dessert whose name means 'pierced ear,' traditionally shaped with a hole in the center. Made with rice flour and sugar, it is deep-fried until crisp.
A traditional Thai dessert made from glutinous rice flour and coconut milk, shaped into small dumplings and coated in grated coconut. It is soft, chewy, and mildly sweet.
A traditional Thai dessert made from rice flour, tapioca flour, coconut milk, and sugar, steamed into colorful layers. It is soft, chewy, and often prepared in 9 layers to symbolize prosperity.
A traditional northern Thai dessert made from glutinous rice flour shaped into small balls, boiled, and coated in grated coconut. It is chewy, mildly sweet, and often served at local festivals.
Glutinous rice flour dumplings filled with palm sugar and rolled in grated coconut. It is chewy, sweet, and commonly prepared for traditional ceremonies.
A steamed dessert made from palm sugar, rice flour, and coconut milk. It is fluffy, sweet, and has a distinct aroma from toddy palm fruit.
A Thai dessert served in small ceramic cups, made with rice flour, coconut milk, and sugar. It has a salty-sweet coconut topping over a soft base.
A fluffy Thai dessert made from rice flour, sugar, yeast, and coconut milk, steamed until it rises and 'blooms.' It is colorful, light, and mildly sweet.
A popular Thai street snack made from rice flour pancakes filled with shredded coconut, sugar, and sesame. The name means 'broken bucket,' symbolizing good fortune.

thai_script: ขนมถั่วแปบ
description: A traditional Thai snack made from glutinous rice flour dumplings filled with mung beans and coated with grated coconut and sugar. It is soft, chewy, and lightly sweet.
A Thai dessert made from glutinous rice flour dough filled with either sweet mung bean paste or savory peanut filling, wrapped in banana leaves and steamed. Traditionally eaten during festivals.
image_url: https://dessertsmate.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/08/42-สูตรขนมเทียนไส้หวาน.jpg

thai_script: ขนมน้ำดอกไม้
description: A soft Thai dessert made from rice flour, sugar, and jasmine-scented water, steamed into delicate flower-like shapes. It has a sweet, floral aroma and a fluffy texture.
A traditional Thai Muslim dessert made from glutinous rice flour mixed with coconut milk, wrapped in banana leaves, and steamed. It is soft, mildly sweet, and often enjoyed during festivals.

thai_script: ขนมบ้าบิ่น
description: A Thai sweet snack made from glutinous rice flour, shredded coconut, sugar, and coconut milk, grilled until golden and chewy. It is fragrant and lightly sweet.
image_url: https://dessertsmate.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/09/146-ขนมบ้าบิ่นมันม่วง-เนื้อนุ่ม-หอมมัน.jpg

description: A famous Thai street snack made with crispy rice flour shells filled with sweet or savory toppings, often coconut cream, shredded coconut, or shrimp. It is crunchy and flavorful.
A pastry with Chinese origins, made with flour and filled with mung bean paste, taro, or salted egg yolk. It is flaky, soft, and slightly sweet.
Small round cookies made with flour, sugar, and coconut milk. They are crumbly, melt-in-the-mouth, and aromatic with a toasted coconut flavor.

thai_script: ขนมฝรั่งกุฎีจีน
description: A Portuguese-influenced Thai dessert from the Kudi Chin community, made with flour, sugar, and dried fruits. It resembles a sponge cake with a rich, sweet flavor.

thai_script: ขนมเปียกปูน
description: A soft, jelly-like dessert made from rice flour, palm sugar, and coconut milk, often black in color from burnt sugar or pandan. It is chewy, sweet, and aromatic.

thai_script: ขนมมันสำปะหลัง
description: A chewy Thai dessert made from grated cassava mixed with flour, sugar, and coconut milk, then baked or steamed until golden. It is sweet, dense, and fragrant.

thai_script: ขนมเมืองเพชร
description: A specialty dessert from Phetchaburi province, famous for sweets made with palm sugar, rice flour, and coconut milk. It reflects the region’s rich dessert-making tradition.
A Southern Thai dessert made from rice flour and sugar, spun into delicate lace-like threads and fried. It is crispy, golden, and traditionally offered during merit-making ceremonies.

thai_script: ขนมลืมกลืน
description: A soft Thai dessert made from rice flour, sugar, and coconut milk, with a jelly-like texture that melts in the mouth. Its name means 'so delicious you forget to swallow.'

thai_script: ขนมลูกกวาด
description: A rare Thai sweet, literally meaning 'candy sweet,' traditionally made with sugar syrup and shaped into colorful, glossy pieces. It is mostly found in older regional recipes.

thai_script: ขนมหม้อแกง
description: A rich Thai dessert made from flour, coconut milk, sugar, and eggs, often baked with taro, mung beans, or fried shallots on top. It is sweet, creamy, and fragrant.
image_url: https://wa-mitrpholsugar-new.azurewebsites.net/wp-content/uploads/2022/09/Web-Feature-img_ขนมหม้อแกงไข่ขาว_1568x1044.jpg

description: A chewy Thai sweet snack made from rice flour mixed with sugar and coated in sesame seeds. It is nutty, lightly sweet, and eaten as a local treat.

thai_script: ข้าวต้มน้ำวุ้น
description: A Thai dessert made from glutinous rice cooked with coconut milk and sugar, sometimes served with syrup or jelly. It is soft, sweet, and comforting.
image_url: https://dessertsmate.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/09/120-ข้าวต้มน้ำวุ้น-เหนียวนุ่ม-หวานหอม.jpg

description: A sweet snack made from leftover toasted rice mixed with sugar and coconut milk, pressed into soft, crumbly cakes. It is rustic, sweet, and fragrant.
A crispy Thai snack made from rice flour and sugar, sometimes mixed with coconut milk before being sun-dried and puffed over heat. It is crunchy and mildly sweet.
image_url: https://dessertsmate.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/09/125-ข้าวเกรียบว่าว-หรือข้าวโป่งขนมทานเล่นโบราณ.jpg

description: A ceremonial Thai dessert made from young green rice simmered with coconut milk and sugar. It has a smooth, porridge-like consistency and is often offered during festivals.
A famous Thai dessert of glutinous rice mixed with coconut milk and sugar, then slow-cooked inside bamboo tubes. It is smoky, sweet, and slightly sticky.

thai_script: ข้าวเหนียวมะม่วง
description: A world-famous Thai dessert made with sweet glutinous rice, fresh ripe mango slices, and rich coconut milk. It is sweet, creamy, and refreshing.
A general term for Thai sweets, traditionally made with rice flour, coconut milk, and sugar. This entry refers to an old-fashioned style of dessert preparation.
A rare royal Thai dessert shaped like a crown, made with flour, sugar, egg yolks, and scented jasmine water. It symbolizes honor and high status.
A cooling Thai dessert made from grass jelly, usually served with syrup, crushed ice, or mixed with milk tea. It is refreshing and mildly bitter-sweet.
image_url: https://dessertsmate.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/10/166-เฉาก๊วยโบราณ-หวานหอมน้ำตาลทรายแดง.jpg

description: A Thai dessert made from colorful strands of mung bean or rice flour vermicelli served in sweetened coconut milk with crushed ice. It is refreshing and lightly sweet.
A traditional royal Thai dessert shaped like a golden star, made from flour, sugar, and egg yolks. It is delicate and symbolizes wealth and prosperity.
A Southern Thai dessert made with taro, sweet potato, and black beans cooked in sweet coconut milk. It is hearty, creamy, and mildly sweet.
A soft and silky tofu pudding served in a warm syrup made with sugar, ginger, or pandan. It is light, smooth, and often enjoyed as a comforting dessert.
image_url: https://cheewajit.com/app/uploads/2020/09/เต้าฮวยน้ำขิง-02.jpg

thai_script: ถั่วเขียวต้มน้ำตาล
description: A simple Thai dessert made from boiled mung beans simmered in sweet syrup, sometimes finished with coconut milk. It is sweet, soft, and nourishing.
A traditional Thai dessert made from egg yolks and flour dripped into boiling syrup to form golden teardrop shapes. It is soft, sweet, and symbolizes prosperity.
A traditional Thai royal dessert made from egg yolks, flour, and sugar, shaped into delicate flower-like forms. It symbolizes wealth and prosperity.
One of Thailand’s most exquisite desserts, made from egg yolks, flour, and sugar, molded into golden flower shapes. It represents elegance and is often given as a gift of good fortune.

thai_script: ทับทิมกรอบ
description: A refreshing Thai dessert of water chestnuts coated in tapioca flour, dyed red to resemble rubies, and served in sweetened coconut milk with ice.
A popular Thai street dessert made with finely shaved ice, flavored syrups, coconut milk, and assorted toppings such as fruits, jellies, or beans. It is colorful and cooling.
A rare and old-fashioned Thai dessert whose name literally translates to 'ghost died in swamp.' It is made with flour, coconut milk, and palm sugar, giving it a dark and rich sweetness.
image_url: https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8e/Food_仙草%2C_米苔目%2C_呷二嘴%2C_台北_%2818285267406%29.jpg/1200px-Food_仙草%2C_米苔目%2C_呷二嘴%2C_台北_%2818285267406%29.jpg

description: A dessert of Portuguese origin, made from egg yolks drizzled into sugar syrup to form golden threads. It is symbolic of longevity and prosperity in Thai culture.

thai_script: ฟักเขียวกวน
description: A traditional Thai dessert made by simmering wax gourd with sugar and coconut milk until thick and sticky. It is sweet, fragrant, and chewy in texture.
A chewy dessert made from ripe mango purée cooked with sugar and spread into thin sheets to dry. It has a tangy-sweet flavor and is often enjoyed as a snack.
A rare Thai dessert believed to be prepared from flour, coconut milk, and sugar, shaped into soft sweet confections. It is found in regional and traditional recipes.
A classic Thai dessert made from mung bean paste mixed with sugar and egg yolk, shaped to resemble jackfruit seeds, and simmered in syrup. It is smooth, golden, and delicately sweet.
A traditional Thai dessert of delicate steamed rice flour noodles, served with sweetened coconut milk. It is fragrant, soft, and lightly sweet.

thai_script: โรตีสายไหม
description: A popular street snack from Ayutthaya, consisting of thin roti wraps filled with colorful spun sugar (cotton candy). It is sweet, chewy, and crunchy at the same time.
A chilled dessert made with pandan-flavored rice flour noodles served in sweetened coconut milk and crushed ice. Refreshing and popular during hot weather.
A traditional Thai dessert made from sweetened mung bean paste shaped and painted to resemble miniature fruits. It is coated in a shiny gelatin glaze for a colorful, glossy finish.
A refreshing Thai dessert of seasonal fruits soaked in syrup with ginger, shallots, and a pinch of salt. It has a sweet, tangy, and slightly spicy flavor.
A Thai custard made from eggs, coconut milk, and sugar, slowly stirred until thick. It is rich, creamy, and often eaten with sticky rice.

thai_script: สังขยา (นึ่ง)
description: A steamed Thai custard made with eggs, coconut milk, and palm sugar. Often served in banana leaf cups or used as a filling for pumpkin or bread.
A glutinous rice flour dessert with a chewy texture, traditionally filled with mung bean or sweetened peanut paste. Its name means 'red tortoise cake' and it is often served at festive occasions.
A rare traditional dessert with limited documentation, believed to be a steamed or rice-based sweet found in local Southern Thai or Peranakan communities.
A traditional Thai dessert thought to be influenced by Malay sweets, made with rice flour, coconut milk, and sugar. It has a soft texture and a rich, sweet flavor.
A colorful Thai dessert made from wheat flour, sugar, and coconut milk. It is piped into flower-like shapes and baked until the outer shell is crisp while the inside remains soft.
A refreshing shaved ice dessert from Phuket made with banana-flour jelly, red beans, and syrup. It is light, cooling, and popular during hot weather.
A modern Thai street dessert made by pouring milk onto an iced metal pan, mixing with fruits or cookies, then scraping into rolls. Known internationally as Thai rolled ice cream.
